article_node.title: Gov. Newsom confirms California plans to redraw congressional maps as battle with Texas heats up
article_node.summary: California Governor Gavin Newsom announced plans to redraw congressional district maps to potentially gain five additional Democratic seats, countering a similar effort by Texas Republicans backed by former President Trump. The move, set for a special election on November 4, is seen as a response to Texas Democrats fleeing the state to block redistricting efforts. Newsom's proposal has sparked controversy, with critics arguing it undermines the independent redistricting commission established by voters. The situation reflects a broader national struggle over redistricting and partisan power dynamics.
